metaTitle: 3 Спален Bungalow €270,000 Pilar de La Horadada Costa Blanca
metaDescription: Премиум 3-bedroom bungalow €270,000 in Pilar de La Horadada. Ideal retirement home with expat community, healthcare, and year-round sunshine. 40% less than island markets.
heroIntro: Welcome to peaceful retirement living on Spain's Costa Blanca. This exceptional 3-bedroom bungalow in Parque Ramon Eugenio Escudero offers the relaxed lifestyle you've earned, priced at just €270,000—remarkable value for a premium-specification property that costs 40% less than comparable homes on Spanish island markets. Pilar de La Horadada has become a haven for British and international retirees seeking genuine value without compromise on quality or community. This bungalow sits within an established neighbourhood where English is widely spoken, healthcare is accessible, and daily life moves at a pace that suits those ready to slow down. With 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms across 67 square metres of thoughtfully designed living space, this home offers the perfect balance of compact efficiency and comfortable living. The property represents outstanding value in a market gaining 8% annually, while the established expat community means you'll never feel isolated—yet have all the peace and privacy retirement demands.
areaSection: Pilar de La Horadada sits on the southern Costa Blanca, positioned between the vibrant tourist areas to the north and the quieter Spanish coastline to the south. This positioning offers the best of both worlds: proximity to amenities and beaches without the overwhelming tourism of major resorts. The town enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine, with mild winters averaging 15°C and warm summers rarely exceeding 32°C—ideal for those escaping harsher climates. The area maintains an authentic Spanish character while hosting one of Spain's largest international communities. The nearby beaches are uncrowded compared to more developed coastal areas, and the landscape features the distinctive white villages and pine forests typical of inland Alicante. Local infrastructure has developed significantly, with modern healthcare facilities, shopping centres, and recreational amenities serving both Spanish residents and the growing expat population.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Pilar de La Horadada revolves around genuine relaxation and community connection. Mornings might include a coffee at a local café where you'll likely hear English, Spanish, and several other languages—the international community here is welcoming and well-established. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets supplemented by traditional weekly markets offering fresh produce. The pace is noticeably slower than UK life: long lunches, afternoon paseos (walks), and evening social gatherings are the norm. Healthcare is a key comfort for retirees—English-speaking doctors and modern private clinics operate alongside the regional hospital just 30 minutes away. Beaches with Blue Flag status are within 20 minutes' drive, ideal for leisurely walks or gentle swimming. The expat community organises regular social events, bridge clubs, golf outings, and cultural activities, ensuring you're never short of companionship. Yet the beauty of this location is the freedom to be as social or solitary as you prefer—the infrastructure supports both.
investmentSection: While primarily suited to owner-occupiers seeking retirement homes, this property offers solid investment credentials. The Costa Blanca market has grown 8% year-on-year, with Pilar de La Horadada benefiting from increased demand from northern European buyers. Comparable properties in the area typically rent for €800 per week during peak season, providing optional income if you decide to let the property during your absences. At €4,030 per square metre, this property commands a premium to the local average (€2,200/m²) due to its quality specification, yet remains 40% cheaper than equivalent properties on Spanish islands like Mallorca or Ibiza. The established infrastructure, growing expat population, and improving healthcare facilities suggest continued appreciation. Whether viewed as a forever home or a long-term investment, this property offers financial stability in a stable, established market segment.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom bungalow represents more than a property purchase—it's your gateway to the retirement lifestyle you've earned. At €270,000, you're securing a premium-specification home in an established, welcoming community where English is spoken, healthcare is accessible, and daily life moves at your preferred pace. The combination of exceptional value, proven market growth, and proven community infrastructure makes this an outstanding choice for British and international retirees. Whether you're seeking full-time Mediterranean living or a flexible base for extended European stays, this property delivers genuine value without compromise. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Pilar de La Horadada provides all daily necessities within easy reach, alongside quality healthcare and international education options. The town's infrastructure supports comfortable, practical living without requiring constant trips to distant centres, allowing retirees to maximise leisure time.

healthcare.text: Healthcare access is a primary consideration for retirees, and this location excels. English-speaking doctors operate in private clinics throughout the area, with the nearest clinic just 8 minutes' drive from this property. The Vega Baja Regional Hospital provides comprehensive services within 30 minutes, including emergency care. Many residents maintain private health insurance (available at reasonable cost), offering rapid access to specialists and elective procedures. The healthcare system combines Spanish efficiency with growing international staff accustomed to serving expat populations. Prescription medications are affordable, and dental care is substantially cheaper than UK prices while maintaining high standards.
keyPoints: Private clinic with English-speaking doctors - 8 minutes drive
Vega Baja Regional Hospital - 30 minutes drive
Prescription medication costs 50-70% below UK prices

education.text: While primarily relevant for visiting grandchildren, educational facilities reflect the area's quality standards. International schools throughout the region offer British curriculum options, with established institutions in nearby Torrevieja and Orihuela Costa. These schools serve both expat families and Spanish students seeking English-language education, creating multicultural environments. Primary and secondary education is available, with many schools offering boarding options. The presence of quality international education influences property values and community stability, ensuring the area continues attracting families alongside retirees.
keyPoints: International School of Torrevieja - 22 minutes drive

shopping.text: Weekly shopping is straightforward and enjoyable. Mercadona (Spain's largest supermarket chain) is within walking distance, stocking both Spanish products and international brands favoured by expats. Lidl and Consum supermarkets provide competitive pricing and choice. Beyond supermarkets, traditional weekly markets in Pilar de La Horadada town centre offer fresh produce, fish, and prepared foods at local prices. Larger shopping centres in Orihuela Costa and Torrevieja (20-30 minutes) provide department stores and specialist retailers. The combination of local markets and modern supermarkets suits those who enjoy either quick, efficient shopping or leisurely market exploration.

transport.text: Getting around Pilar de La Horadada is manageable with or without a car. Bus connections serve the town and surrounding areas, with schedules suited to local living rather than tourism. Most retirees find a car beneficial for flexibility and weekend exploration, though driving in Spain requires an IDP (International Driving Permit). Alicante Airport, Spain's main southern gateway, is 45 minutes' drive, offering direct flights to the UK and European destinations. The local roads are well-maintained, and parking is readily available throughout the area. For those preferring not to drive, the established community includes car-share arrangements and organised transport services.
keyPoints: Organised community transport available for events

faqs.question: Сколько стоит эта недвижимость?
faqs.answer: €270,000. This figure represents exceptional value for a premium-specification 3-bedroom bungalow with full utilities and community access. The property is 40% cheaper than equivalent homes on Spanish islands while offering superior location value compared to the local Pilar de La Horadada average of €2,200/m².

faqs.question: Является ли Коста-Бланка хорошим местом для покупки недвижимости?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is excellent for property investment and residence. The region experiences 8% annual property appreciation, has established infrastructure, reliable healthcare, and hosts one of Europe's largest international communities. It offers better value than other Spanish coastal regions while maintaining quality amenities and services.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can buy property in Spain without restrictions. Non-Spanish citizens require an NIE (tax identification number) and may need to register with tax authorities, but the process is straightforward with professional legal assistance. Many British retirees own Spanish property without obtaining Spanish residency.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs: property transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (€600-1,500), land registry costs (€300-800), and legal fees (€1,000-2,000). Annual costs include property tax (0.4-1.1% of value), community fees (€30-150 monthly), and utilities. Total acquisition costs typically run 8-12% above the purchase price.

faqs.question: Подходит ли Коста-Бланка для пенсионеров?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is outstanding for retirees. It offers year-round sunshine, affordable living costs, excellent healthcare with English-speaking doctors, established international communities, beaches, golf, and low crime rates. Healthcare accessibility and cost-of-living advantages are particularly attractive for retirement budgeting.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca cost of living is approximately 30-40% lower than the UK. Groceries cost €15-25 weekly for two people, dining out €12-18 per person, utilities €80-120 monthly, and private healthcare insurance €50-100 monthly. Retirees typically budget €1,500-2,000 monthly for comfortable living.

faqs.question: Как далеко Коста-Бланка от России?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is approximately 1,000 miles from the UK, with Alicante Airport offering direct flights in 2.5-3 hours. Multiple daily flights from UK airports make visiting family straightforward, typically costing €50-150 per flight when booked in advance.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine with temperatures averaging 15°C in winter and 28-30°C in summer. Winters rarely drop below freezing, and extreme heat is uncommon. Rainfall is minimal (200-250mm annually), making it ideal for those escaping British weather.

faqs.question: Нужна ли мне виза для покупки недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: No visa is required specifically for property purchase. However, if you plan to reside in Spain long-term, you'll need appropriate residency status. Post-Brexit, British citizens can visit for 90 days without visa, but longer residence requires establishing residency through work, family ties, or retirement income requirements.

faqs.question: What is the property tax situation for foreign owners in Spain?
faqs.answer: Foreign property owners pay the same taxes as Spanish residents: property tax (IBI) at 0.4-1.1% annually, plus income tax if renting the property. Non-resident owners pay non-resident property income tax (19-24%) if letting the property. Professional tax advice is essential for optimising your tax position.
